official-title.#text: Congratulating and honoring Malala Yousafzai, recipient of the 2014 Nobel Peace Prize.

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text:
congratulates Malala Yousafzai on receiving the 2014 Nobel Peace Prize, which is awarded for her
			 outstanding achievements;

honors Malala Yousafzai for her contribution to global education equality and the promotion of
			 peace;

states that in honoring Malala Yousafzai, it also honors those who have promoted education equality
			 including those individuals who continue to champion the fundamental right
			 of all children to a peaceful education in Pakistan and elsewhere; and

emphasizes that violations of human rights in general, and the persecution of children
			 specifically, are matters of legitimate concern to all nations.

Whereas the Nobel Peace Prize is an international award administered by the Nobel Foundation in
			 Stockholm, Sweden;
Whereas the Nobel Peace Prize has been awarded for outstanding achievements in peace since 1901;

quote.#text:
done the most or best work for fraternity between nations, for the abolition or reduction of
			 standing armies and for the holding and promotion of peace congresses

text.#text:
Whereas the Nobel Peace Prize is awarded by the Norwegian Nobel Committee, a group of five members
			 appointed by the Storting, the Norwegian Parliament, in Oslo, Norway, to
			 recognize individuals who have

Whereas, currently, an estimated 13 million school age girls are deprived of an education in
			 Pakistan;

Whereas, to date, Pakistani girls’ schools continue to be targeted by militants, including through
			 bombings and threats to teachers; and

Whereas Ms. Yousafzai’s courageous campaign for equal education represents a critically important
			 effort in making the world a more peaceful place: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 750 IH: Congratulating and honoring Malala Yousafzai, recipient of the 2014 Nobel Peace Prize.
